intro: Moehringia sperguloides, commonly known as the slender moehringia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. The plant has delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces tiny, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Moehringia sperguloides is a member of the Montiaceae family and is known for its ecological significance in supporting local insect populations.
